positive.review:
The game itself was fun, but expecting us to pay another $40 for the same game with patches is crazy.

"Relaunched" = give us money you stupid consumers.

Surviving Mars: Relaunch: re-purchase the same game again.  PASS.  Spend US$40 for an updated game from Paradox?  PASS.  I can't seem to create a review on the relaunched store page because I don't own it.  I don't own it because I won't pay for it.  This original "is no longer available on the Steam store" - PARADOX, why must you be the worst?

I'll keep my buggy (?) one (honestly, i don't think I witnessed any bugs, it is a sim that you need to keep massive numbers of colonists busy and happy, I see no problems).

It doesn't really matter recommended yes or no; the original this review is being left under is a YES (that cannot be purchased any more), the relaunched is a hard NO.
Anything between fun and relaxing to challenging. Very nice game with fun mechanics.

the city building and resource management mechanics all comes together to make for a fun experience. with the expansions they have added since release have brought a lot to further the experience. the music is also nice to listen too. overall, this game gives you constant challenges to overcome while giving you the satisfaction of progression the whole way. if your into this kind of game I would absolutely recommend.
I have hundreds of hours playing here and more on console. This game and fantastic with a ton of great mods.

Leaving my review now for having played this obsessively 4 years ago.
Wonderful complexity in building colonies, lots of problems to solve, from your own incompetence as a resource distributor to actual planetary phenomenon.
Once you figure out how to reliably build and expand it can become a bit routine, but thats what the extra difficulties are for.
Bugs and annoying behaviours are very rare and not that severe at all, but can be a pain when they happen at the wrong time, but are mostly a symptom of trying to do too much with not enough people/transporters/resources

I am looking forward to the remaster. This game is a great combination of city builder, sci-fi, and exploration.  This game allows you to make it as hard or easy as you like. You can settle any part of the planet and the random events are plentiful enough that no two games feel the same. I haven't played in a bit due to other games, however with the remaster I cant wait. This is one of the best in this genre.

After almost 400 hours, I 100% recommend this game. 

Most of the recent negative reviews are people upset that Surviving Mars Relaunched isn't a simple patch to this game. Relaunched is receiving updates every few days to address issues with that game. Yes, there are issues with new content released while Abstract was in charge. However, mods have fixed that vast majority of things people are upset with. Most of those people refuse to use mods to solve problems. They'd rather just complain a review bomb instead. 

If you are looking at this game as a new player....there are issues with Below and Beyond DLC. That is the only DLC that I do NOT see as fixed. To me, it honestly adds the least amount of new content anyways. But don't be afraid to find a mod that fixes something you don't like. I've played with over 40 mods at a time with zero issues. Don't let the salty people ruin this for everyone else.

Relaunched is a buggy mess that really was not ready for release.

OG Surviving Mars is still the superior product as of today. Can't believe people are giving the original a negative review just because they are mad about the reboot. (Or having to pay for the same product again)

ignore the dimwits review bombing this game because they cant read what the relaunched version actually is. Its a total ground up remake in a newer engine. Not just a simple set of bugfixes. 

This game is great for what it is and I had a ton of fun with it. There were two very badly implemented DLC but beyond those OPTIONAL purchases this game was a great deal of fun for me as evidenced by my 145hrs in it

One of my all time favorite games, and since I've been playing video games since Pong in the mid 1970s that's saying something. 

Currently this version of the game is now de-listed on Steam in favor of the newer relaunched version of the game. People seem to have a lot of feels about that and are stupidly review bombing this version of the game instead of that one. Me, I'm just glad to see the game go back into active development with new expansions and fixes, and that's worth the few bucks they're asking as far I'm concerned. 

But regardless, that's neither here nor there. No matter how you feel about Surviving Mars Relaunched, the original Surviving Mars is a great game that deserves to keep it's very positive review score.

[Edit to add: Some poor soul just jestered this review. It took a special kind of stupid to prove my point that way, so thanks for being such a great example of why I felt the need to write it.]

Paradox gives the original game away for free in 2021. Didn't buy any of the DLCs. Decide its time to play the game finally. Learn about a "remaster" with all DLC included. Get the game for 50 percent off with all DLC. Seems like I won.

These Review Bombs are just stupid! This game is like a decade old and it is still one of the best city builders out there. Do you actually think the publisher can afford to just fix an old game. They have to pay their people so stop being entitled little a** holes. Play the game and give it a real review and be happy that they are adding additional elements to the game for more fun. The cost of this game will probably finance a Surviving Mars 2.

If you are new to the game, this is an awesome deal. You get all the DLCs and a new political layer. Furthermore you will be playing an improved movement system for your citizens that will solve issues from the past and help minimize micromanagement. This is one of the best colonizing games out there. I'd argue that it is the best considering stupid games like planet base. Go. Enjoy. Colonize. Terraform.

Everyone complaining about Surviving Mars needing to be free: are you not reading that there is going to be future DLCs as well or are just reading what you want to read? Makes no sense why you would want everything for free. All games have flaws, big deal! You should be grateful Paradox is putting new clothes on an already great game and appreciate that they're also promising future content as well. Plus 20 bucks for everyone who previously owned it? Thats a steal.
great game and the relauch has more stuff and every dlc. and if you own the 2018 version you get 50% off this stuff cost money so poeple need to stop complanin its not free.
SimCity benzeri şehir kurma simulasyonu ancak ortam çok fantastik. Plan, program, strateji ve sabır.

Screw all the people review bombing that want stuff for free, they remade the game from the ground up in an entirely different game engine and people want it for free? Great logic there, there's a difference between wanting bug fixes and wanting a remastered version in a new engine with new models completely for free. You're not entitled to a free game just because it's a remaster, because they remade everything, remaster, not a re-release.
Don't blame the developers, blame the publisher, I fucking hate Paradox.
For sure a amazing mars survival management game!
A very fun game in desperate need of more love from Paradox.
Enjoyable world-builder with different stages.
OG game is wonderful, Fuck paradox for rebooting a shitware as a new game.

I can see the argument that other people have about being mad about having to essentially pay for bug fixes but if you only have the base version of the old game or a few of the many DLC's, it seems like the relaunch will be a great deal. I remember liking the game and wasn't aware of the extensive amount of content they have released for it, so in a couple of days when they allow for buying the new version I will definitely be getting it.
Looking forward to the relaunch on November 10. This is a fun game and I suggest you give it a try.

negative.review: I re-installed this game when I saw that they were FINALLY fixing the bugs, just to learn that I would have to buy the game again?!?! What a crock.

Why fix a broken game when you can abandon it and charge people all over again for a shitty "remaster"?

Top tier capitalism.

And now that this version's been pulled from sale, it's not like our negative reviews even matter.

Well, here I am, screaming into the void anyway.

Impressive how Paradox just seems to get worse and worse as a company.

Shameful and disappointing, but unfortunately not surprising.

Why is Gabe allowing publishers to remove an old game I've paid money just to force me to buy the same game again by calling it "relaunched"?

They haven't even fixed the old bugs!

Does Paradox want to pionneer being utterly banned by the player community?
No names change will save them... Since Kerbal Space II i have already banned them fully, now i will pay even more attention to it, because it is not acceptable to make a "buy the game again" when you are just fixing some bugs... Proper care & products will never deceive you, Fooling your customers is only fooling yourselves...

They added the fixes as a new version you have to buy all over again, and then they delisted THIS version and all DLCs. This just makes me determined to not buy the new game due to this act of pure greed.

You really just relaunched the game I payed a full price for a couple of years ago?? This type of stuff is supposed to happen 10 or 15 years after release, not 6 or 7 years after release and not improving the base game!! 
Sad to see your company go this way...
I loved this game, unfortunately the devs have decided to repackage this game and charge everyone more for it with the relaunch. cannot in good faith recommend giving this company money

I loved this game. The soundtrack I still listen to, to this day. 
I didn't even hear about Surviving Mars: Relaunched and then I see all this crap. It just puts such a horrible and bad taste in my mouth for the original I just don't even know what to say and do anymore. Genuinely I was like I wish they re did this game...and now I see this I kinda regret it. 
So disappointing but didn't expect anything better from Paradox. They are well known for ruining anything the second time...Cities Skylines II, Blood Masquerade - Bloodlines 2...do I dare mention Cities in Motion 2? 
Very sad day indeed.

game is abandoned for 3+ years and now they bundle the whole thing with some makeup, and charge $40 for it instead of patching the current game! 

great job devs.
Bought the original game and now I have repurchase it just get access to a future DLC. Screw me once shame on me. Screw me twice shame on YOU! Screw your existing customers SHAMELESS!
Fix your shitty game before releasing the same game again. Copy and pasted bugs.
Have to buy the game again for bug fixes? Is this an attempt by Paradox to create a new form of DLC?

Thanks for the opportunity to rebuy the same game with all the DLCs I already bought and new promises that may never happen. I really appreciate this move and will never buy anything else from devs. Here's an idea for the next "community meeting": sell every patch as a new game, like `Surviving-Mars-dev-build-schem-casino-final-ultimate-release-42`

I love this game, don't buy it. 
Paradox is a very parasidic company that hides key gameplay updates behind DLC.
I had accepted that, after all dispite the gross DLC practices CK3 was still getting decent updates.
Then I found out that this game I love -Surviving Mars- wouldn't be getting updates. 
No. Instead, I'd need to buy the game again for updates, bug/performance fixes and even then there'd still be more DLC down the pipeline!
The fact the Paradox thinks we'll keep buying this is a joke.
Guess I'm the real clown then, because I know I will...
If you value your time, sanity, and money don't play any of Paradox games. 
It's too late for me I'm afraid.

Its fun game. But to pay again for the update??? Nope. And now i was looking for DLC for the 2018 game. None. So if i want DLC on my version of game. I need to buy again the whole game. Why???? That doesnt make sense. 50% off for owners of the older game? That is what?? One thing to make it better. Turn it to the old game. AND PUT THAT DLCs AT BUNDLE. Nooooooo. We got for you the same game but better. Only need to buy. Its good game. I enjoy it. But thats not how you sell your product. Its only for money? And the happiness from the customer? I hope the developer will get to his sense. Until then. I will play that 2018 edition what they call it now.

Not recommended. I’ve spent 364 hours in this version of Surviving Mars, much of it using mods to work around long-standing bugs, only to see Paradox abandon it, repackage the bug fixes and QoL improvements as “Surviving Mars: Relaunched,” and charge again for what is essentially a paid patch. This original version is now frozen and delisted with its DLC no longer sold, so existing owners are stuck with a broken game unless we rebuy it. As someone who owns 15+ Paradox games and DLC, this feels like a catastrophic breach of trust; at the very least, existing players should receive a free upgrade or deep discount instead of being told to purchase the same game again just to finish the content and get fixes. The colony sim underneath is good, but I cannot recommend a product tied to a business model that asks you to pay twice for the same game and treats long-time customers as expendable.
Abandoned to release and "Relaunched edition" forcing players to buy the game again.
should have given everyone a free copy or massive discount maybe even a update for everyone that has this game but no gotta make me pay for the game a second time

Sad to see they pulled an ark survival evolved and After initially being excited that there was bug fixes coming, that was CRUSHED by learning id be buying the same game again instead of receiving it as an upgrade. Could have been fun, would have put more time in. But I am  not buying bug fixes. Also heard alot of bugs are popping up in the new version as well

I own this game and bought all the DLC for it when they released. Now they have taken them away, and are trying to force me to buy their "relaunch" for 40 Euro.

Absolutely not. I suggest the developers go for a stroll on the surface of mars. With no helmet.

I have 300h in this game and own all DLC besides B&B. Which was bugged beyond bearable so I refund it.
The original game launched in 2018 was promising but abandoned for the past several years. And I stopped playing it as nobody in Paradox cared about it anymore. Now Paradox wants our money again, for the same game and apparently - if you read the recent reviews - the same bugs. They have the audacity to remove the original game from Steam and present it like brand new, remastered game. Don't believe it.

I advise you not to trust them with the DLC they are promising for this one. Look what happened with Cities II Ultimate version.
Many were falling for Paradox promises and trusted them with their wallet but no more. 
PS. most of the positive reviews you will see are written for the 2018 game. Not for this so-called ''remastered'' recycled game.
abandoning a game and then charging full release price for bugfixes is an unacceptable business practice

De-listing a game from 2018 to force everyone to buy a new version to gain access to the DLC and content we previously had.

DO NOT SUPPORT PUBLISHERS THAT REMOVE WHAT YOU PREVIOUSLY OWNED!

It was a good game and I enjoyed it. But re-releasing it is just a spit in the face of your customers. I'm not asking for free content. Make an expansion, make a successor or make DLC. But don't just remove my game from the store and ask me to re-buy it so I get newer content.

Loved playing the game, wanted to buy expansions, now I can't because remaster is out and by the looks of it, it is even worse than the original.

Whoever planned this, congratulations, you pissed a lot of people.

I loved this game, it was a great game, and I say that in spite of the *massive* problems it had and the desperate need for re-tuning and bug fixing.  If you think I am going to re-buy the same game for full price to get the fixes that you should have provided for your players to make the game that we bought and paid you for function properly you are out of your mind.  I've uninstalled Surviving Mars and kissed paradox goodbye- I am starting to vote with my wallet more and more.  I already cut out EA and now your'e joining them Paradox.  It's time for the gaming community to insist that game companies provide quality products for the outlandish prices they are charging us and to put and end to the constant nickle and diming us to death tactics.
They broke the game and now they expect us to re-buy the game in order to get the fix. ya, no.

Can't get DLC for the original game? I wanted to add Martian express but it takes me to the buy relaunch page. Absolutely love the game but you sh!t the bed on this occasion.

UPDATE: For about the price of the DLC I can get the whole game again (due to half price sale), so I did. Still not changing my thumb direction as it's still a d!ck move

Love the game but this recent move is such a slap in the face to all their customers. Now, instead of even having the option to buy the one expansion pack I don't already own, I only have the option to completely rebuy the entire game. This is such a disgustingly greedy move and I HIGHLY recommend not to give them a PENNY unless they reverse this course of action and provide the new version for free to the people who already purchased their game or at very least, a cheap upgrade cost. Being forced to rebuy the game is NOT ACCEPTABLE! I have already requested a refund for the original game, not because I expect them to grant it, but in the hopes that Steam Support being swarmed by refund requests push them to take action against Paradox.
Instead of updating the base game I've already spent over $100.00 on in total, they relaunched a new game that has to be purchased again. How scummy can you be?

Only reason i'm leaving this review is to let Paradox know they need to treat their fanbase better.

Re-releasing the same exact game only a few years later but now with the added bugfixes that they should have implemented in some of their DLC's that they completely abandoned just a few years ago screams unprofessionalism .

Was looking for games to replay and thought about this - Have read now they have re-released it as a new version and now I cant buy the DLC without rebuying the game again? Yeah no thanks, Money grubbing company just wants to get people to rebuy it.
Imagine the Developer patch the game and re-bundle it and ask you to re-buy the game again

Just came back to play this again and saw an announcement for a "relaunch", with the listed price only being 20USD for a good chunk of DLC (assuming you own the original), and specifically advertised bugfixes and improvements. Now, I'd be up for an ultimate edition that featured a graphics update, DLC, and maybe some new whackier ideas, but paying for bugfixes in the digital age on an online storefront feels scummy. In my head, the best course of action is a bugfix update for the original game that also adds in advertisement for the relaunch, avoiding alienating old players, earning goodwill to buy the new relaunch as this would demonstrate support for the IP overall, and avoid the accusation of bad business practice Paradox all-to-often receives. Paradox's reputation is bad for a reason, and its because of stuff like this, I just wish they could see the cost of goodwill and community support really isn't as steep as they seem to think.

As for the game, was a simple and somewhat bland colony builder with a focus on making new runs after completing a predetermined crisis. Did enjoy events that fundamentally changed my circumstances, requiring me to adapt quickly to maximize rewards and minimize problems. Felt from the get-go that this game over-advertises itself as this life changing experience at times that's far more nuanced than it really is. For some similar games you may also like that I've played, check out Against The Storm for that "re-run" style colony sim, Dotage for dramatic world events forcing you to adapt rapidly, and maybe Plan-B Terraform if terrain manipulation is why your here (Though thats moreso an automation game). Thanks for reading.
